page.title: 04Imperial War Museum, Duxford
page.content: {Duxford Airfield,}part of the{Imperial {Museum,}houses most of the Museum's aircraft collection, many other large exhibits, and the Duxford Aviation Society's collection of{British civil {aircraft.}The airfield is also an important exhibit in its own right; three hangars from the 1st World War have been preserved there. The { {Operations Block,}built in 1928, now houses the Schools Room. Over 80 aircraft are on display, from a{1st World War BE2C}to modern jets, including over 20 aircraft from the 2nd World War period. There is also a collection of civil aircraft, a number of which, including{Concord 01,}are normally open to the public for a small charge. There are over 30 tanks and other military vehicles on display, along with guns,missiles and a midget submarine.
